title: ryx
text: package compute correlations data frame. also creates custom type called ‘ryx’ calling ryx function, custom functions printing, summarizing plotting objects package.

title: ryx
text: Computes correlations, stores ‘ryx’ object dependent, independent, data frame stored within contains use info
code: library(MASS) x <- ryx(Boston, y="medv")  #or an example using the independent variable parameter data(mtcars) x <- ryx(mtcars, y="mpg", x=c("wt", "vs"))

title: ryx
text: Takes ryx object prints correlation dataframe displaying correlation significance variable.

title: ryx
text: Provides summary statistics correlations, : median correlation, range correlation, many variables statistically significant. #plot.ryx Plots ryx object scatter plot x axis correlation y-axis independent variables
code: summary(ryx(Boston, y="medv")) #> Correlating  medv  with  crim zn indus nox rm age dis tax ptratio black lstat  #>  The median absolute correlation was -0.3883046 with a range from  -0.7376627  to  0.6953599  #>  11 out of 11 was significant at the p < 0.05 level. summary(ryx(mtcars, y="mpg", x=c("wt", "vs"))) #> Correlating  mpg  with  wt vs  #>  The median absolute correlation was -0.1018102 with a range from  -0.8676594  to  0.6640389  #>  2 out of 2 was significant at the p < 0.05 level. plot(ryx(Boston, y="medv")) plot(ryx(mtcars, y="mpg", x=c("wt", "vs")))

title: Ryx
text: goal ryx calculate correlation different values data frame give summary stats, corelation matrix graph.

text: can install development version ryx GitHub :

title: Ryx
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(ryx) ## basic example code data(mtcars) x <- ryx(mtcars, y="mpg", x=c("wt", "vs"))

title: print.ryx — print.ryx
code: #example 1 #print(ryx(Boston, y="medv")) #example2 print(ryx(mtcars, y="mpg", x=c("wt", "vs"))) #> Correlations of mpg with  #>      variable          r            p sigif #> cor        wt -0.8676594 1.293959e-10   *** #> cor1       vs  0.6640389 3.415937e-05   ***

title: ryx — ryx
text: function calculates correlations dependent variable y one independent x variables.

title: ryx — ryx
text: data dataset contains relevant variables y name numeric variable data frame independent variable x character vector names one numeric variables data frame. Defaults numeric columns dataframe

title: ryx — ryx
text: obect type 'ryx' 3 attributes, dependent variable, list independent variables, dataframe showing correlation significance independent variable dependent.

title: ryx — ryx
code: if (FALSE) { #calculate correlation on 'medv' in the dataframe, uses all numeric columns ryx(Boston, y="medv") #can specify indepenent vars, and be assigned to a var x <- ryx(mtcars, y="mpg", x=c("wt", "vs")) }
